title: RIP Escape Velocity movement speed :(
body:
The removal of Sol's escape velocity will really hurt his chasing, there was nothing more useful in a chase (or as hilarious to watch), when chasing someone who is juuuust outside the range of your stars, and you just see sol creep closer and closer as escape velocity ramps up the movement speed. and then **BAM** that first star hits and suddenly that enemy champ belongs to you.

Not to mention how inconvenient comet of legend will be now that you cant click to stop it..


:(

replies.body:
Hey,
Just thought you should know, that his E is relatively the same (apart from the what is mentioned here below).

JUST KEEP FLYING Comet of Legend can now only be cancelled by recasting the ability
BLASTOFF Aurelion now takes flight immediately, even if cast outside the cast range
AUTOCORRECT When cast during Comet of Legend, Starsurge now travels in the same direction as Aurelion Sol if it was cast just slightly off-angle

the passive bonus MS when traveling in a signal direction is still a thing. It's just instead of waiting for a 100 stacks of escape velocity before being able to cast comet of legend, you can cast it when ever, as long as you haven't taken damage recently.
 
http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-619-notes
But you lose the movement speed boost that having stacks of velocity gave to you though

Exactly what Seras dragon is saying.
Sol's is by far my favourite champion, so if you have anymore questions, please ask away.

Sol is by far my fave champ too, Im lvl 7 with over 100,000 mastery points on him.


I haven't had a chance to play him today so i cant confirm wether the movement speed is gone or not, but it DID come under 'escape velocity'

The other changes will be annoying too though, not being able to exit comet of legend by clicking will put an end to smooth exits, especially if your comet of legend is aimed correctly.

Also why does he need 'auto correction'? You shouldn't have to rely on an aim-bot to land your Q, you just just aim it properly in the first place.

I feel like Riot is trying to do one of two things here, or even both. 
They might be trying to make new Sol players have a better experience while playing him. or they are trying to just smooth off his kit and minimise little mistakes. It says "Starsurge now travels in the same direction as Aurelion Sol if it was cast just slightly off-angle" so you can still completely whiff it.

Edit:But this could cause some problems if you needed it to be slightly off-angle.
